title: How to Clean Out Your Home

steps.headline: Pick an area in your home to start with, preferably the most cluttered (your room,the  study, storeroom...)
Start by choosing a corner in that room and taking everything out and putting them on the floor.
Sort the objects out in order of value starting from (Real rubbish to I might have kept this for some reason to Definitely cannot throw away or lose).
steps.description: Hint: If you haven't used it, seen it, thought of it or knew it existed for more than 2 years, put it in the rubbish pile and don't look back.

steps.headline: Get the largest plastic/paper bag and put all the rubbish inside.
Sort out all the stuff you have kept for no apparent reason other than the feeling that it might come in useful someday into various categories.
Decide what has to go.
steps.description: Here, we really need to sometimes force ourselves to throw away little knick knacks, weird stuff that we have been collecting.Add these to the bag(s) of rubbish.

steps.headline: Arrange the remainder of the stuff neatly so that after you're done your important stuff can be found easily and is not under piles of trash.
Work your way around the room, then around your home and then it will look very VERY neat and less claustrophobic.

text: Pick an area in your home to start with, preferably the most cluttered (your room,the  study, storeroom...)  Start by choosing a corner in that room and taking everything out and putting them on the floor.  Sort the objects out in order of value starting from (Real rubbish to I might have kept this for some reason to Definitely cannot throw away or lose). Hint: If you haven't used it, seen it, thought of it or knew it existed for more than 2 years, put it in the rubbish pile and don't look back. Get the largest plastic/paper bag and put all the rubbish inside.  Sort out all the stuff you have kept for no apparent reason other than the feeling that it might come in useful someday into various categories.  Decide what has to go. Here, we really need to sometimes force ourselves to throw away little knick knacks, weird stuff that we have been collecting.Add these to the bag(s) of rubbish. Arrange the remainder of the stuff neatly so that after you're done your important stuff can be found easily and is not under piles of trash.  Work your way around the room, then around your home and then it will look very VERY neat and less claustrophobic.
